input: What is the default entry for an 80% efficient gas burner?
output: A burner that is 80% efficient would have an entry of 0.8 here which is the default.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the gas preheat coil parasitic electric load?
output: Enter the parasitic electric load associated with the gas heating operation such as a combustion fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: In what units is the parasitic electric load for the gas preheat coil measured?
output: The units are in W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the maximum outdoor air flow rate?
output: Enter autosize or a value for the maximum amount of outdoor air flow into the unit when the economizer is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'autosize' mean for the maximum outdoor air flow rate?
output: Autosize means that 100% of the full supply flow may be taken from outdoor air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What units are used for the maximum outdoor air flow rate?
output: The units are in m3/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the entered value for maximum outdoor air flow rate?
output: The entered value is used to define the Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate for the Controller:OutdoorAir object that will be generated by this template.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the minimum outdoor air flow rate?
output: Enter autosize or the value for the minimum amount of outdoor air that can enter the unit and be distributed to the zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for minimum outdoor air flow rate?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the entered value for minimum outdoor air flow rate?
output: The entered value is used to define the Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate for the Controller:OutdoorAir object that will be generated by this template.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the minimum outdoor air control type?
output: Choices for this field are FixedMinimum or ProportionalMinimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does FixedMinimum mean for the minimum outdoor air flow rate?
output: FixedMinimum means that the minimum outdoor air flow rate is fixed no matter what the actual system flow rate is.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does ProportionalMinimum mean for the minimum outdoor air flow rate?
output: ProportionalMinimum means the minimum outdoor air flow rate varies in proportion to the total system air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for minimum outdoor air control type?
output: The default is ProportionalMinimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if you want the minimum outdoor air to be the same for all hours in the entire year?
output: Leave this field blank if you want the minimum outdoor air to be the same for all hours in the entire year.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do the values in the schedule for minimum outdoor air schedule name represent?
output: Values are decimal fractions (0.0 -- 1.0) that multiply the minimum outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the minimum outdoor air schedule?
output: This schedule is useful for reducing the outdoor air flow rate to zero during unoccupied or start up hours.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options for the economizer type field?
output: The options for this field are FixedDryBulb DifferentialDryBulb FixedEnthalpy DifferentialEnthalpy ElectronicEnthalpy (i.e. humidity ratio curve strategy) FixedDewPointAndDryBulb DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy and NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing NoEconomizer mean?
output: Choosing NoEconomizer means the economizer will not operate and the outdoor airflow rate will be at the minimum for the entire simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing FixedDryBulb mean for the economizer?
output: Choosing FixedDryBulb means the economizer will set the outdoor airflow rate at minimum if the outdoor air temperature is higher than a specified dry-bulb temperature limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing DifferentialDryBulb mean for the economizer?
output: Choosing DifferentialDryBulb will trigger the outdoor airflow to minimum when the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air is higher than the dry-bulb temperature of the return air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does FixedEnthalpy check for the economizer?
output: FixedEnthalpy checks the upper limit of the enthalpy given as a field input against the enthalpy content of outdoor air and will set the outdoor airflow rate to minimum if the latter is greater than the former.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does DifferentialEnthalpy do for the economizer?
output: DifferentialEnthalpy does the same thing but compares the return air enthalpy with the enthalpy of outdoor air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'FixedMinimum' mean in the context of outdoor air flow rate?
output: FixedMinimum means that the minimum outdoor air flow rate is fixed no matter what the actual system flow rate is.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'ProportionalMinimum' mean in the context of outdoor air flow rate?
output: ProportionalMinimum means the minimum outdoor air flow rate varies in proportion to the total system air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the minimum outdoor air flow rate?
output: The default is ProportionalMinimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if you leave the 'Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name Name' field blank?
output: Leave this field blank if you want the minimum outdoor air to be the same for all hours in the entire year.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of specifying a schedule name for the 'Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name Name' field?
output: If a schedule name is specified values are decimal fractions (0.0 -- 1.0) that multiply the minimum outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How can the schedule for minimum outdoor air flow rate be used?
output: This schedule is useful for reducing the outdoor air flow rate to zero during unoccupied or start up hours.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options for the 'Economizer Type' field?
output: The options for this field are FixedDryBulb DifferentialDryBulb FixedEnthalpy DifferentialEnthalpy ElectronicEnthalpy FixedDewPointAndDryBulb DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy and NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'NoEconomizer' mean for the economizer operation?
output: Choosing NoEconomizer means the economizer will not operate and the outdoor airflow rate will be at the minimum for the entire simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when 'FixedDryBulb' is chosen for the economizer type?
output: Choosing FixedDryBulb means the economizer will set the outdoor airflow rate at minimum if the outdoor air temperature is higher than a specified dry-bulb temperature limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the condition for triggering the outdoor airflow to minimum when 'DifferentialDryBulb' is chosen?
output: Choosing DifferentialDryBulb will trigger the outdoor airflow to minimum when the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air is higher than the dry-bulb temperature of the return air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'FixedEnthalpy' check in the economizer control strategy?
output: FixedEnthalpy checks the upper limit of the enthalpy given as a field input against the enthalpy content of outdoor air and will set the outdoor airflow rate to minimum if the latter is greater than the former.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the difference between 'FixedEnthalpy' and 'DifferentialEnthalpy' in economizer control?
output: DifferentialEnthalpy compares the return air enthalpy with the enthalpy of outdoor air and sets the outdoor air flow rate to minimum when the enthalpy of outdoor air is greater than the enthalpy of the return air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does 'ElectronicEnthalpy' work in the economizer control strategy?
output: Choosing ElectronicEnthalpy enables the simulation to calculate the humidity ratio limit of outdoor air based on the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air and a quadratic/cubic curve and compare it to the actual outdoor air humidity ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the actual outdoor humidity ratio is greater than the calculated humidity ratio limit in 'ElectronicEnthalpy'?
output: If the actual outdoor humidity ratio is greater than the calculated humidity ratio limit then the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb' compare in economizer control?
output: Choosing FixedDewPointAndDryBulb compares both the outdoor dewpoint temperature and the outdoor dry-bulb temperature to their specified high limit values.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if either outdoor temperature exceeds the high limit value in 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb'?
output: If either outdoor temperature exceeds the high limit value the outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What strategy does 'DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy' enable in economizer control?
output: DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy enables the control strategy to be based on both the DifferentialDryBulb and DifferentialEnthalpy economizer control strategies.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What additional checks are performed for each economizer control type?
output: Each control type checks for user-entered values for the upper limit of dry-bulb temperature enthalpy limit humidity ratio limit and dewpoint limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the 'Economizer Type' field?
output: The default for this field is NoEconomizer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the only choice for the 'Economizer Lockout' field?
output: The only choice for this field is NoLockout.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Economizer Lockout' field?
output: The default value is NoLockout.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What may future versions include for the 'Economizer Lockout' field?
output: Future versions may have additional options.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Economizer Upper Temperature Limit' field?
output: Enter the outdoor air temperature high limit (째C) for economizer operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor air temperature is above the limit set in 'Economizer Upper Temperature Limit'?
output: If the outdoor air temperature is above this limit the outdoor air flow rate will be set to the minimum and heat recovery will be enabled if available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does no input or zero mean in the 'Economizer Upper Temperature Limit' field?
output: No input or zero in this field means that there is no outdoor air temperature high limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the enthalpy of outdoor air is greater than the enthalpy of the return air?
output: The outdoor air flow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'ElectronicEnthalpy' enable in the simulation?
output: It enables the simulation to calculate the humidity ratio limit of outdoor air based on the dry-bulb temperature of outdoor air and a quadratic/cubic curve and compare it to the actual outdoor air humidity ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the actual outdoor humidity ratio is greater than the calculated humidity ratio limit?
output: The outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does choosing 'FixedDewPointAndDryBulb' compare?
output: It compares both the outdoor dewpoint temperature and the outdoor dry-bulb temperature to their specified high limit values.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if either outdoor temperature exceeds the high limit value?
output: The outdoor airflow rate is set to minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'DifferentialDryBulbAndEnthalpy' option enable?
output: It enables the control strategy to be based on both the 'DifferentialDryBulb' and 'DifferentialEnthalpy' economizer control strategies.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do all economizer control types check for?
output: They check for user-entered values for the upper limit of dry-bulb temperature enthalpy limit humidity ratio limit and dewpoint limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Economizer Lockout' field?
output: The default value is 'NoLockout'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The outdoor air flow rate will be set to the minimum and heat recovery will be enabled if available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does no input or zero in the 'Economizer Lower Temperature Limit' field mean?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor air enthalpy is above the upper enthalpy limit?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the outdoor air temperature low limit for economizer operation?
output: Enter the outdoor air temperature low limit (째C) for economizer operation. If the outdoor air temperature is below this limit the outdoor air flow rate will be set to the minimum and heat recovery will be enabled if available. No input or zero in this field means that there is no outdoor air temperature low limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the outdoor air upper enthalpy limit for economizer operation?
output: Enter the outdoor air upper enthalpy limit (in J/kg) for economizer operation. If the outdoor air enthalpy is above this value the outdoor air flow rate will be set to the minimum and heat recovery will be enabled if available. No input or zero in this field means that there is no outdoor air enthalpy limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the outdoor air dewpoint limit for economizer operation?
output: Input for this field is the outdoor air dewpoint limit (쨘C) for economizer operation. If the outdoor air dewpoint temperature is above this value the outdoor airflow rate will be set to the minimum. This field is required if the Economizer Control Type `FixedDewPointAndDryBulb has been specified. No input (blank) in this field means that there is no outdoor air dewpoint limit control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Cold Supply Plenum Name field?
output: Set to blank if no cold supply plenum is to be modeled. If a cold supply plenum is modeled it must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered here. This supply plenum serves the cold inlets of all zones on this system. If any zone supply plenums have been specified the outlet from the system supply plenum will flow through the zone supply plenum to the zone terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Hot Supply Plenum Name field?
output: Set to blank if no hot supply plenum is to be modeled. If a hot supply plenum is modeled it must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered here. This supply plenum serves hot inlets of all zones on this system. If any zone supply plenums have been specified the outlet from the system supply plenum will flow through the zone supply plenum to the zone terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Return Plenum Name field?
output: Set to blank if no return plenum is to be modeled. If a return plenum is modeled it must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered here. This return plenum serves all zones on this system. If any zone return plenums have been specified the return air from the zone will flow through the zone return plenum and then into the system return plenum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the system behavior during times when the System Availability Schedule is zero?
output: Enter the system behavior during times when the System Availability Schedule is zero (off). The possible inputs are StayOff CycleOnAny or CycleOnControlZone. StayOff means the system will remain off no matter how hot or cold the zones may be. CycleOnAny means that if any zone served by this system has an air temperature outside the cooling or heating set points the central fan will turn on even though the System Availability Schedule indicates the fan is off. CycleOnControlZone means the same thing except the availability manager looks at the temperature in only the zone specified in Night Cycle Control Zone Name. The default is StayOff.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Night Cycle Control Zone Name field?
output: For the Night Cycle Control option Cycle On Control Zone enter the name of the control zone. For other Night Cycle Control options this field is ignored.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: Enter the type of air-to-air heat recovery which is available between the relief air stream and the outdoor air inlet stream. The choices are: None Sensible Enthalpy. The default is None.

output: The outlet from the system supply plenum will flow through the zone supply plenum to the zone terminal unit.

output: It must be modeled as a zone with surfaces and the name of the plenum zone should be entered.

output: The return air from the zone will flow through the zone return plenum and then into the system return plenum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Heat Recovery Heat Exchanger Type' field denote?
output: This alpha field denotes the type of heat exchanger being modeled: Plate (e.g. fixed plate) or Rotary (e.g. rotating cylinder or wheel).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default choice for the 'Heat Recovery Heat Exchanger Type' field?
output: The default choice for this field is 'Plate'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the heat exchanger type affect the modeling?
output: The heat exchanger type affects the modeling of frost control options and supply air outlet temperature control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is frost formation or supply air outlet temperature controlled for rotary heat exchangers?
output: For rotary heat exchangers rotational speed is varied to control frost formation or the supply air outlet temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the desired effect obtained for plate exchangers?
output: For plate exchangers air bypass around the heat exchanger is used to obtain the desired effect.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the 'Heat Recovery Frost Control Type' field?
output: This alpha field has four choices: None ExhaustAirRecirculation ExhaustOnly and MinimumExhaustTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default frost control type if the 'Heat Recovery Frost Control Type' field is left blank?
output: The default frost control type is 'None'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is preheat frost control modeled?
output: For modeling preheat frost control specify 'None' for this input field and insert a separate heating coil object in the supply inlet air stream to keep the air temperature above the desired frost threshold temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens in the 'ExhaustAirRecirculation' frost control type?
output: Dampers are used to direct exhaust air back into the zone through the supply side of the heat exchanger when the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature falls below a threshold temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What determines the fraction of time exhaust air is circulated through the supply side of the heat exchanger in 'ExhaustAirRecirculation'?
output: The fraction of time that exhaust air is circulated through the supply side of the heat exchanger is dependent on the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature with respect to the threshold temperature the initial defrost time fraction and the rate of change of defrost time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when exhaust air is being recirculated in 'ExhaustAirRecirculation'?
output: When exhaust air is being recirculated no supply (outdoor ventilation) air is being provided through the heat exchanger unit (which may or may not be acceptable regarding ventilation for occupants).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens in the 'ExhaustOnly (supply air bypass)' frost control type?
output: This control cycles off the supply air flow through the heat exchanger for a certain period of time while the exhaust air continues to flow through the exhaust side of the heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What determines the fraction of time the supply flow through the heat exchanger is cycled off in 'ExhaustOnly'?
output: The fraction of time that the supply flow through the heat exchanger is cycled off is dependent on the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature with respect to the threshold temperature the initial defrost time fraction and the rate of change of defrost time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What provisions are made in real applications for 'ExhaustOnly' frost control?
output: Provisions are usually made to avoid building depressurization when this frost control is operating (automatic or pressure-operated dampers or a bypass air damper around the supply side of the heat exchanger).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is assumed for the supply air during 'ExhaustOnly' frost control operation?
output: It is assumed that the supply air is bypassed around the heat exchanger during frost control operation (i.e. the total supply flow is not reduced during defrost but merely bypassed around the heat exchanger).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens in the 'MinimumExhaustTemperature' frost control type?
output: The temperature of the exhaust air leaving the heat exchanger is monitored and the heat exchanger effectiveness is decreased (by slowing heat exchanger rotation or bypassing supply air around the plate exchanger) to keep the exhaust air from falling below the threshold temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the dehumidification control type options available?
output: There are two dehumidification control type options available: None and CoolReheat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'CoolReheat' option do?
output: The 'CoolReheat' option cools beyond the dry-bulb setpoint as required to meet the humidity setpoint if the system is capable of doing so.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is provided as required by the terminal in the 'CoolReheat' option?
output: Reheat is provided as required by the terminal.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What factors influence the fraction of time that the supply flow through the heat exchanger is cycled off?
output: The fraction of time that the supply flow through the heat exchanger is cycled off is dependent on the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature with respect to the threshold temperature the initial defrost time fraction and the rate of change of defrost time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when exhaust air is being recirculated?
output: When exhaust air is being recirculated no supply (outdoor ventilation) air is being provided through the heat exchanger unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the control mechanism for the 'ExhaustOnly' frost control type?
output: The 'ExhaustOnly' control cycles off the supply air flow through the heat exchanger for a certain period of time while the exhaust air continues to flow through the exhaust side of the heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What provisions are usually made when the 'ExhaustOnly' frost control is operating?
output: Provisions are usually made to avoid building depressurization when this frost control is operating such as automatic or pressure-operated dampers or a bypass air damper around the supply side of the heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What assumption is made for the 'ExhaustOnly' frost control type regarding the supply air?
output: It is assumed that the supply air is bypassed around the heat exchanger during frost control operation meaning the total supply flow is not reduced during defrost but merely bypassed around the heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the 'MinimumExhaustTemperature' frost control type work?
output: The 'MinimumExhaustTemperature' frost control type monitors the temperature of the exhaust air leaving the heat exchanger and decreases the heat exchanger effectiveness to keep the exhaust air from falling below the threshold temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the two dehumidification control type options available?
output: The two dehumidification control type options available are 'None' and 'CoolReheat'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'CoolReheat' dehumidification control option do?
output: The 'CoolReheat' option cools beyond the dry-bulb setpoint as required to meet the humidity setpoint if the system is capable of doing so and reheat is provided as required by the terminal unit reheat coils if available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default dehumidification control type?
output: The default dehumidification control type is 'None' which meets the sensible cooling setpoint only.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Dehumidification Control Zone Name' field specify?
output: The 'Dehumidification Control Zone Name' field specifies the zone name where the humidistat is located for controlling dehumidification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is specified by the 'Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint' field?
output: The 'Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint' field specifies the zone humidistat setpoint for dehumidification in percent (0 to 100) with a default of 60%.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a 'Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name' is specified?
output: If a 'Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name' is specified the 'Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint' field is ignored.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name' field?
output: The name of the dehumidification setpoint schedule should be entered in the 'Dehumidification Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule Name' field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the two humidifier type options available?
output: The two humidifier type options available are 'None' and 'ElectricSteam'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'ElectricSteam' humidifier option use?
output: The 'ElectricSteam' humidifier option uses the 'Humidifier:Steam:Electric' object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default humidifier type?
output: The default humidifier type is 'None'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the 'Humidifier Availability Schedule Name' field is left blank?
output: If the 'Humidifier Availability Schedule Name' field is left blank the humidifier will be available anytime the system is operating.

output: A schedule value of zero denotes that the humidifier cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: NonCoincident sizes on the sum of the noncoincident zone design supply air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: Enter the name of the dehumidification setpoint schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default sizing option for the system supply air flow rate?
output: The default is NonCoincident.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does entering 'Yes' in the 'Return Fan' field indicate?
output: Enter 'Yes' if the system has a return fan. The default is 'No'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the total efficiency of the return fan defined?
output: Enter the total efficiency of the return fan. This is the ratio of the power delivered to the air to the electrical input power at maximum flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the range for the return fan total efficiency?
output: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default return fan delta pressure?
output: The default is 500 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the return fan motor efficiency defined?
output: Enter the shaft power of the return fan divided by the electrical power consumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the range for the return fan motor efficiency?
output: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Return Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field specify?
output: Enter the fraction of the motor heat that is added to the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 in the 'Return Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field indicate?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 1 in the 'Return Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field indicate?
output: A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the range for the 'Return Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field?
output: Must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options for the 'Return Fan Part-Load Power Coefficients' field?
output: This alpha field has the following choices: InletVaneDampers OutletDampers VariableSpeedMotor ASHRAE90.1-2004Appendix G VariableSpeedMotorPressureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default option for the 'Return Fan Part-Load Power Coefficients' field?
output: The default is InletVaneDampers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What figure shows the resulting power curves for the VAV supply fan part-load power coefficient options?
output: The resulting power curves are shown in Figure~\\reffig:vav-supply-fan-part-load-power-coefficient.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the relationship between fan motor efficiency and fan efficiency?
output: The product of the fan motor efficiency and fan (impeller) efficiency is the ratio of the power delivered to the air to the electrical input power at maximum flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is motor efficiency defined?
output: Motor efficiency is the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is fan efficiency defined?
output: Fan efficiency is the power delivered to the air divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the constraints on the efficiency values?
output: Efficiency must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the 'Return Fan Delta Pressure' field?
output: Enter the pressure rise in Pa at full flow and standard conditions. Standard conditions are considered 20째C at sea level 101325 Pa. The default is 500 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the 'Return Fan Motor Efficiency' field?
output: Enter the shaft power of the return fan divided by the electrical power consumed. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the 'Return Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field?
output: Enter the fraction of the motor heat that is added to the air stream. A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream. A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise. Must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What choices are available for the 'Return Fan Part-Load Power Coefficients' field?
output: The choices are: InletVaneDampers OutletDampers VariableSpeedMotor ASHRAE90.1-2004Appendix G VariableSpeedMotorPressureReset. The default is InletVaneDampers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where do the ASHRAE 90.1-2004 Appendix G coefficients come from?
output: The ASHRAE 90.1-2004 Appendix G coefficients are from TABLE G3.1.3.15 Method 2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where do the other sets of coefficients come from?
output: The other sets of coefficients are from the EnergyPlus Input Output Reference Fan Coefficient Values table.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the 'VariableSpeedMotorPressureReset' option based on?
output: The 'VariableSpeedMotorPressureReset' option is based on Good Static Pressure Reset VSD Fan from Energy Design Resources: Design Guidelines: Advanced Variable Air Volume (VAV) Systems (EDR_DesignGuidelines_VAV.pdf).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What figure shows the VAV Supply Fan Part-Load Power Coefficient Options?
output: The figure showing the VAV Supply Fan Part-Load Power Coefficient Options is referenced as Figure~\\reffig:vav-supply-fan-part-load-power-coefficient.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> listing
input: What is an example of an IDF entry for an HVAC template system?
output: An example of an IDF entry for an HVAC template system is: HVACTemplate:System:DualDuct DD Sys 1 !-Name FanAvailSched !- System Availability Schedule Name Single !- Supply Fan Configuration Type autosize !- Main Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate m3/s 0.2 !- Main Supply Fan Minimum Flow Fraction 0.7 !- Main Supply Fan Total Efficiency 600 !- Main Supply Fan Delta Pressure Pa 0.9 !- Main Supply Fan Motor Efficiency 1 !- Main Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction InletVaneDampers !- Main Supply Fan Part-Load Power Coefficients autosize !- Cold Duct Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate m3/s 0.2 !- Cold Duct Supply Fan Minimum Flow Fraction 0.7 !- Cold Duct Supply Fan Total Efficiency 600 !- Cold Duct Supply Fan Delta Pressure Pa 0.9 !- Cold Duct Supply Fan Motor Efficiency 1 !- Cold Duct Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction InletVaneDampers !- Cold Duct Supply Fan Part-Load Power Coefficients DrawThrough !- Cold Duct Supply Fan Placement autosize !- Hot Duct Supply Fan Maximum Flow Rate m3/s 0.2 !- Hot Duct Supply Fan Minimum Flow Fraction 0.7 !- Hot Duct Supply Fan Total Efficiency 600 !- Hot Duct Supply Fan Delta Pressure Pa 0.9 !- Hot Duct Supply Fan Motor Efficiency 1 !- Hot Duct Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction InletVaneDampers !- Hot Duct Supply Fan Part-Load Power Coefficients DrawThrough !- Hot Duct Supply Fan Placement ChilledWater !- Cooling Coil Type.

output: G coefficients are from TABLE G3.1.3.15 Method 2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The other sets of coefficients are from the EnergyPlus Input Output Reference Fan Coefficient Values table.
