instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What types of HVAC template zones can the HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir be used with?
output: It can be used with HVACTemplate:Zone:BaseboardHeat HVACTemplate:Zone:FanCoil HVACTemplate:Zone:PTAC HVACTemplate:Zone:PTHP HVACTemplate:Zone:WaterToAirHeatPump and HVACTemplate:Zone:VRF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the characteristic of the HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir in terms of volume?
output: It is a constant volume dedicated outdoor air system which can serve multiple zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What components can the HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir have?
output: It may have any combination of heating coil cooling coil and heat recovery.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What controls are available for the HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir?
output: It may have dehumidification and humidification controls as well as several supply temperature control types.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the air supply characteristic of the HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir when available?
output: It supplies 100% outdoor air when the system is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is assumed about the return air in the HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir?
output: It assumes an equal volume of return air is available for heat recovery.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the modeling approach if the system does not have actual return ducts?
output: If the system collects flow from exhaust fans to a central heat recovery point this approach should be equivalent.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the system does not have heat recovery and the air is exhausted?
output: The return path of this system will simply be a path to dump the flow as relief air with no impact on energy use.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What does Figure 161 depict?
output: Figure 161 depicts a DOAS serving three zones with PTACs.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Can there be more than one HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir object in an IDF file?
output: Yes there may be more than one HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir object in an IDF file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is a zone specified to be served by a DOAS system?
output: If a zone is to be served by one of these systems this is specified in the HVACTemplate:Zone:* object using the field 'Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens to the outdoor air flow rate in the zone equipment when served by a DOAS system?
output: The outdoor air flow rate in the zone equipment (fan coil PTAC etc.) will be set to zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the inputs section?
output: This field is a unique name which the user assigns to this system which can then be referred to in an HVACTemplate:Zone:* object to specify that this system provides outdoor air to that zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if you want the system to operate at all times?
output: Leave the 'Field: System Availability Schedule Name' blank if you want the system to operate at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should operating times be specified if a schedule name is used for system availability?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the system is operating should be specified as 1.0 and those times that the system is not operating should have a zero value in the schedule specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What combinations can a dedicated outdoor air system have?
output: It may have any combination of heating coil cooling coil and heat recovery.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What controls and supply temperature control types can a dedicated outdoor air system have?
output: It may have dehumidification and humidification controls as well as several supply temperature control types.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the air supply condition when the dedicated outdoor air system is available?
output: It supplies 100% outdoor air when the system is available and assumes an equal volume of return air is available for heat recovery.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if the system does not have actual return ducts?
output: If the system to be modeled does not have actual return ducts but collects flow from exhaust fans to a central heat recovery point then this approach should be equivalent.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the system does not have heat recovery and the air is exhausted or leaves by exfiltration?
output: The return path of this system will simply be a path to dump the flow as relief air with no impact on energy use.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What does Figure 161 illustrate?
output: Figure 161 illustrates a DOAS serving three zones with PTACs.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How many HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir objects can be in an idf file?
output: There may be more than one HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir object in an idf file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is a zone specified to be served by a dedicated outdoor air system?
output: If a zone is to be served by one of these systems this is specified in the HVACTemplate:Zone:* object using the field 'Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens to the outdoor air flow rate in the zone equipment for zones served by a DOAS system?
output: For zones which are served by one of these DOAS systems the outdoor air flow rate in the zone equipment (fan coil PTAC etc.) will be set to zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the inputs section?
output: This field is a unique name which the user assigns to this system which can then be referred to in an HVACTemplate:Zone:* object to specify that this system provides outdoor air to that zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should you do with the 'Field: System Availability Schedule Name' if you want the system to operate at all times?
output: Leave this field blank if you want the system to operate at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 1.0 in the 'Field: System Availability Schedule Name' indicate?
output: A value of 1.0 indicates that the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a zero value in the 'Field: System Availability Schedule Name' indicate?
output: A zero value indicates that the system is not operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is specified in the 'Field: Air Outlet Type'?
output: This field indicates if the air is delivered directly into the zone(s) or into the other system(s) that serve the zone(s) (e.g. fan coil system).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the only option available for the 'Field: Air Outlet Type'?
output: The only option available is DirectIntoZone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does entering 'Autosize' in the 'Field: Supply Fan Flow Rate' do?
output: Entering 'Autosize' sets the system maximum air-flow rate to the sum of the zone air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a value is entered for the maximum air-flow rate in the 'Field: Supply Fan Flow Rate'?
output: It is the upper limit on system flow even if the zone air flow inputs sum to a greater value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the 'Field: Supply Fan Flow Rate'?
output: The units are m쨀/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Supply Fan Total Efficiency'?
output: Enter the total efficiency of the supply fan which is the overall efficiency of the fan i.e. the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the overall efficiency of the fan calculated?
output: It is the product of the motor efficiency and the impeller efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is motor efficiency defined?
output: Motor efficiency is the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is impeller efficiency defined?
output: Impeller efficiency is power delivered to the fluid (air) divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: It is the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Field: Supply Fan Total Efficiency'?
output: The default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the range of acceptable values for the 'Field: Supply Fan Total Efficiency'?
output: This input value must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Field: Supply Fan Delta Pressure'?
output: Enter the pressure rise in Pa at full flow and standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are considered standard conditions for the 'Field: Supply Fan Delta Pressure'?
output: Standard conditions are considered to be 20째C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Supply Fan Motor Efficiency'?
output: Enter the shaft power of the supply fan divided by the electrical power consumed. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the schedule indicate for this system type?
output: The schedule indicates when the system is providing air flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Air Outlet Type' field indicate?
output: This field indicates if the air is delivered directly into the zone(s) or into the other system(s) that serve the zone(s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the only option available for the 'Air Outlet Type' field?
output: The only option available is DirectIntoZone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Supply Fan Flow Rate' field to set the system maximum air-flow rate?
output: Enter Autosize to set the system maximum air-flow rate to the sum of the zone air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the maximum air-flow rate in the 'Supply Fan Flow Rate' field?
output: The units are m쨀/s.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the definition of total efficiency in the 'Supply Fan Total Efficiency' field?
output: Total efficiency is the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the components of total efficiency in the 'Supply Fan Total Efficiency' field?
output: It is the product of the motor efficiency and the impeller efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Supply Fan Total Efficiency' field?
output: The default value is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Supply Fan Delta Pressure' field?
output: Enter the pressure rise in Pa at full flow and standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the standard conditions for the 'Supply Fan Delta Pressure' field?
output: Standard conditions are considered to be 20째C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Supply Fan Motor Efficiency' field?
output: Enter the shaft power of the supply fan divided by the electrical power consumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the range for the 'Supply Fan Motor Efficiency' field?
output: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field represent?
output: It represents the fraction of the motor heat that is added to the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 mean in the 'Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 1 mean in the 'Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction' field?
output: A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the 'Supply Fan Placement' field?
output: The choices are DrawThrough or BlowThrough.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'DrawThrough' option model in the 'Supply Fan Placement' field?
output: DrawThrough models a system where the supply air fan is after the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'BlowThrough' option model in the 'Supply Fan Placement' field?
output: BlowThrough models a system where the supply air fan is before the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default option for the 'Supply Fan Placement' field?
output: The default is DrawThrough.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How many coil types are available in the 'Cooling Coil Type' field?
output: There are seven coil types available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which object does the 'ChilledWater' coil type use?
output: It uses the Coil:Cooling:Water object with the DetailedAnalysis option.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which object does the 'ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel' coil type use?
output: It uses the Coil:Cooling:Water:DetailedGeometry object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which object does the 'TwoSpeedDX' coil type use?
output: It uses the Coil:Cooling:DX:TwoSpeed object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which objects are used by the 'HeatExchangerAssistedChilledWater' coil type?
output: It uses the CoilSystem:Cooling:Water:HeatExchangerAssisted HeatExchanger:AirToAir:SensibleAndLatent and Coil:Cooling:Water objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 mean for the fraction of motor heat added to the air stream?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 1 mean for the fraction of motor heat added to the air stream?
output: A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the valid range for the fraction of motor heat added to the air stream?
output: The fraction must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the two choices for the supply fan placement type?
output: The two choices are DrawThrough and BlowThrough.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the DrawThrough supply fan placement model?
output: DrawThrough models a system where the supply air fan is after the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the BlowThrough supply fan placement model?
output: BlowThrough models a system where the supply air fan is before the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default supply fan placement type?
output: The default is DrawThrough.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the seven available cooling coil types?
output: The seven coil types are ChilledWater ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel TwoSpeedDX TwoStageDX TwoStageHumidityControlDX HeatExchangerAssistedChilledWater HeatExchangerAssistedDX and None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which object does the ChilledWater coil type use?
output: ChilledWater uses the Coil:Cooling:Water object with the DetailedAnalysis option.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which object does the ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel coil type use?
output: ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel uses the Coil:Cooling:Water:DetailedGeometry object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which object does the TwoSpeedDX coil type use?
output: TwoSpeedDX uses the Coil:Cooling:DX:TwoSpeed object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which object do the TwoStageDX and TwoStageHumidityControlDX coil types use?
output: They use the Coil:Cooling:DX:TwoStageWithHumidityControlMode object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which objects does the HeatExchangerAssistedChilledWater coil type use?
output: It uses CoilSystem:Cooling:Water:HeatExchangerAssisted HeatExchanger:AirToAir:SensibleAndLatent and Coil:Cooling:Water objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which objects does the HeatExchangerAssistedDX coil type use?
output: It uses CoilSystem:Cooling:DX:HeatExchangerAssisted HeatExchanger:AirToAir:SensibleAndLatent and Coil:Cooling:DX:SingleSpeed objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil type?
output: The default type is ChilledWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name is left blank?
output: The cooling coil will be available as needed anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of one indicate for the cooling coil?
output: A schedule value of one indicates that the cooling coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of zero denote for the cooling coil?
output: A schedule value of zero denotes that the cooling coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the cooling coil setpoint control types available?
output: The control types available are FixedSetpoint Scheduled and OutdoorAirTemperatureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the FixedSetpoint control type use?
output: FixedSetpoint uses the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint as the supply air setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Scheduled control type use?
output: Scheduled uses the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule to set the supply air setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the OutdoorAirTemperatureReset control type do?
output: OutdoorAirTemperatureReset varies the supply air setpoint based on the values entered for Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High and Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb High.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil setpoint control type?
output: The default is FixedSetpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the user ensure regarding cooling and heating coil setpoints?
output: The user must ensure that the cooling coil and heating coil setpoints do not overlap to avoid unwanted simultaneous heating and cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is recommended regarding the cooling setpoint in relation to the heating coil setpoint?
output: It is recommended that the cooling setpoint always be at least 0.1C higher than the heating coil setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint?
output: Enter the cooling supply air temperature in C to be used for sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What objects are referenced for cooling coil systems?
output: The objects referenced are CoilSystem:Cooling:DX:HeatExchangerAssisted HeatExchanger:AirToAir:SensibleAndLatent and Coil:Cooling:DX:SingleSpeed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default type for the cooling coil?
output: The default type is ChilledWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name field?
output: It is usually left blank to allow the cooling coil to be available as needed anytime the system is operating. If a schedule name is specified it defines when the cooling coil is available often used for seasonal cooling availability.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do the schedule values of one and zero indicate in the Cooling Coil Availability Schedule?
output: A schedule value of one indicates the cooling coil can be on during a given time period while a value of zero denotes that the cooling coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the types of cooling coil setpoint control?
output: The types are FixedSetpoint Scheduled and OutdoorAirTemperatureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the FixedSetpoint control type function?
output: FixedSetpoint uses the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint as the supply air setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the Scheduled control type function?
output: Scheduled uses the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule to set the supply air setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the OutdoorAirTemperatureReset control type function?
output: OutdoorAirTemperatureReset varies the supply air setpoint based on values entered for Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High and Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb High.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil setpoint control type?
output: The default is FixedSetpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the user ensure about the cooling and heating coil setpoints?
output: The user must ensure that the cooling coil and heating coil setpoints do not overlap to avoid unwanted simultaneous heating and cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the recommended temperature difference between the cooling and heating coil setpoints?
output: It is recommended that the cooling setpoint always be at least 0.1C higher than the heating coil setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint used for?
output: It is used for sizing the cooling coil and zone supply air flow rates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default Cooling Coil Design Setpoint temperature?
output: The default is 12.8C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Cooling Coil Setpoint Control Type is set to FixedSetpoint?
output: The Cooling Coil Design Setpoint value is used as the constant cooling supply air setpoint temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field used?
output: It is used when Cooling Coil Setpoint Control Type is Scheduled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule control?
output: The schedule controls the supply air temperature delivered to the zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the significance of fan placement in relation to the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule?
output: For Blow Through fan placement it is the leaving air temperature from the cooling coil. For Draw Through fan placement it is the leaving air temperature after the supply fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for the values in the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule?
output: The values in the schedule are in degrees C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field ignored?
output: It is ignored if the Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type is something other than Scheduled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low?
output: It is the cooling coil supply air setpoint temperature in C when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below the low limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low used?
output: It is used only when Cooling Coil Setpoint Control Type is OutdoorAirTemperatureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low?
output: The default is 15.6C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low field specify?
output: It specifies the low limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature in C for outdoor air reset control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below the Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low?
output: The setpoint is the value of Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Cooling Coil Reset Outdoor Dry-Bulb Low?
output: The default is 15.6C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High?
output: It is the cooling coil supply air setpoint temperature in C when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or above the high limit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High used?
output: It is used only when Cooling Coil Setpoint Control Type is OutdoorAirTemperatureReset.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High?
output: The default is 12.8C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil and zone supply air flow rate temperature?
output: The default is 12.8C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the fixed setpoint value used for the cooling supply air setpoint temperature?
output: If Cooling Coil Setpoint Control Type = FixedSetpoint then this value is also used as the constant cooling supply air setpoint temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field?
output: This field is used when Cooling Coil Setpoint Control Type = Scheduled. The schedule should control the supply air temperature delivered to the zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the schedule control for Blow Through fan placement?
output: For Blow Through fan placement this is the leaving air temperature from the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the schedule control for Draw Through fan placement?
output: For Draw Through fan placement this is the leaving air temperature after the supply fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: In what units are the values in the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule?
output: The values in the schedule are in degrees C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Cooling Coil Setpoint Schedule Name field ignored?
output: This field is ignored if the Cooling Coil Setpoint Reset Type is something other than Scheduled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the cooling coil supply air setpoint temperature when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below the low limit?
output: The cooling coil supply air setpoint temperature in C when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below the low limit is 15.6C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil supply air setpoint temperature for OutdoorAirTemperatureReset?
output: The default is 15.6C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the low limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature for outdoor air reset control?
output: The low limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature in C for outdoor air reset control is 15.6C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the cooling coil supply air setpoint temperature when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or above the high limit?
output: The cooling coil supply air setpoint temperature in C when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or above the high limit is 12.8C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil supply air setpoint temperature for OutdoorAirTemperatureReset at the high limit?
output: The default is 12.8C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the high limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature for outdoor air reset control?
output: The high limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature in C for outdoor air reset control is 23.3C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default high limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature for outdoor air reset control?
output: The default is 23.3C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered to let the automatic sizing algorithm determine the cooling coil gross total cooling capacity?
output: Enter Autosize to let the automatic sizing algorithm determine the cooling coil gross total cooling capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value entered for the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity represent?
output: It represents the full load gross total cooling capacity including both sensible and latent capacity in watts of the DX coil unit at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity?
output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7째C drybulb/19.4째C wetbulb with air entering the outdoor air-cooled condenser coil at 35째C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is meant by 'gross' in the context of DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity?
output: The 'gross' means the effect of supply air fan heat is not accounted for.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the units for DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity?
output: The units are in W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity?
output: The default is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity field used?
output: This field is only used when the cooling coil type is set to one of the DX options.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is assumed for two-speed DX coils regarding the low-speed capacity?
output: For two-speed DX coils the low-speed capacity is assumed to be 0.33 times this value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is assumed for two-stage DX coils regarding the stage 1 capacity?
output: For two-stage DX coils the stage 1 capacity is assumed to be 0.5 times this value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the sensible heat ratio?
output: Enter Autosize to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the sensible heat ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the sensible heat ratio based on?
output: The sensible heat ratio is based on the gross rated cooling total capacity and air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered if not using Autosize for the sensible heat ratio?
output: Enter the value of the ratio of the gross sensible capacity divided by gross total cooling capacity of the DX cooling coil at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio?
output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7째C drybulb/19.4째C wetbulb with air entering the outdoor air-cooled condenser coil at 35째C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the high limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature used for in outdoor air reset control?
output: The high limit of outdoor dry-bulb temperature in C is used for outdoor air reset control. When the outdoor dry-bulb is at or above this temperature the setpoint is the value of Cooling Coil Setpoint at Outdoor Dry-Bulb High. This is used only when Cooling Coil Setpoint Control Type is set to OutdoorAirTemperatureReset. The default is 23.3C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity field?
output: Enter Autosize to let the automatic sizing algorithm determine the cooling coil gross total cooling capacity based on the maximum cooling loads during the cooling design day. If a value is entered it represents the full load gross total cooling capacity including both sensible and latent capacity in watts of the DX coil unit at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity?
output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7째C drybulb/19.4째C wetbulb with air entering the outdoor air-cooled condenser coil at 35째C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the low-speed capacity for two-speed DX coils determined?
output: For two-speed DX coils the low-speed capacity is assumed to be 0.33 times the value of the gross total cooling capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity?
output: The default value is Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the stage 1 capacity for two-stage DX coils determined?
output: For two-stage DX coils the stage 1 capacity is assumed to be 0.5 times the gross total cooling capacity value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio field?
output: Enter Autosize to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the sensible heat ratio based on the gross rated cooling total capacity and air flow rate. Otherwise enter the value of the ratio of the gross sensible capacity divided by the gross total cooling capacity of the DX cooling coil at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for determining the Rated Sensible Heat Ratio?
output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7째C drybulb/19.4째C wetbulb with air entering the outdoor air-cooled condenser coil at 35째C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the low-speed SHR for two-speed DX coils determined?
output: For two-speed DX coils the low-speed SHR is assumed to be equal to the entered value of the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the stage 1 SHR for two-stage DX coils determined?
output: For two-stage DX coils the stage 1 SHR is assumed to be equal to the entered value of the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the humidity control mode SHR for two-stage DX coils with humidity control determined?
output: For two-stage DX coils with humidity control the humidity control mode SHR is assumed to be 0.9 times the entered value of the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio (for both stage 1 and stage 2).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP field?
output: Enter the coefficient of performance defined as the gross cooling coil total capacity in watts divided by electrical power input in watts of the DX cooling coil unit at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP?
output: Rated conditions are air entering the cooling coil at the maximum supply air flow rate at 26.7째C drybulb/19.4째C wetbulb with air entering the outdoor air-cooled condenser coil at 35째C drybulb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What components are included in the input power for the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP?
output: The input power includes electric power for the compressor and condenser fan but does not include the power consumption of the supply air fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP?
output: The default value is 3.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the low-speed COP for two-speed DX coils determined?
output: For two-speed DX coils the low-speed COP is assumed to be 1.5 times the entered value of the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the stage 1 COP for two-stage DX coils determined?
output: For two-stage DX coils the stage 1 COP is assumed to be equal to the entered value of the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the humidity control mode COP for two-stage DX coils with humidity control determined?
output: For two-stage DX coils with humidity control the humidity control mode COP is assumed to be 0.9 times the entered value of the DX Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP (for both stage 1 and stage 2).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the location of the heating coil in the supply air stream?
output: The heating coil is located in the supply air stream downstream of the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if no central heating coil is used in the dedicated outdoor air system?
output: If no central heating coil is used in the dedicated outdoor air system then the option 'none' should be specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The Rated Sensible Heat Ratio (SHR) is defined using both the sensible and total cooling capacities which should be 'gross' meaning the effect of supply air fan heat is not accounted for.

output: The input power includes electric power for the compressor and condenser fan but does not include the power consumption of the supply air fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if no central heating coil is used?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the heating coil type?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must be coordinated if a heating coil is specified?
output: If a heating coil is specified the heating and cooling coil setpoint controls and availability schedules must coordinate to prevent the coils from opposing each other.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the heating coil used for reheat?
output: When the dehumidification control type is set to CoolReheatHeatingCoil the heating coil is used for reheat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the Heating Coil Availability Schedule?
output: Usually left blank which allows the heating coil to be available as needed anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The heat exchanger type affects the modeling of frost control options and supply air outlet temperature control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is frost formation or supply air outlet temperature controlled for rotary heat exchangers?
output: For rotary heat exchangers rotational speed is varied to control frost formation or the supply air outlet temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the desired effect obtained for plate exchangers?
output: For plate exchangers air bypass around the heat exchanger is used to obtain the desired effect.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What choices are available for the 'Heat Recovery Frost Control Type' field?
output: This alpha field has four choices: None ExhaustAirRecirculation ExhaustOnly and MinimumExhaustTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default frost control type if the field is left blank?
output: The default frost control type is 'None'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should preheat frost control be modeled?
output: Specify 'None' for this input field and insert a separate heating coil object in the supply inlet air stream to keep the air temperature above the desired frost threshold temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens in 'ExhaustAirRecirculation' frost control?
output: Dampers are used to direct exhaust air back into the zone through the supply side of the heat exchanger when the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature falls below a threshold temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What factors affect the fraction of time exhaust air is recirculated in 'ExhaustAirRecirculation'?
output: The fraction of time that exhaust air is circulated through the supply side of the heat exchanger is dependent on the supply (outdoor) air inlet temperature with respect to the threshold temperature the initial defrost time fraction and the rate of change of defrost time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What occurs when exhaust air is being recirculated in 'ExhaustAirRecirculation'?
output: When exhaust air is being recirculated no supply (outdoor ventilation) air is being provided through the heat exchanger unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens in 'ExhaustOnly (supply air bypass)' frost control?
output: This control cycles off the supply air flow through the heat exchanger for a certain period of time while the exhaust air continues to flow through the exhaust side of the heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the alpha field 'Heat Recovery Heat Exchanger Type' denote?
output: This alpha field denotes the type of heat exchanger being modeled: Plate (e.g. fixed plate) or Rotary (e.g. rotating cylinder or wheel).

output: The default choice for this field is 'Plate'.

output: The heat exchanger type affects the modeling of frost control options and supply air outlet temperature control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the desired effect obtained for plate exchangers?
output: For plate exchangers air bypass around the heat exchanger is used to obtain the desired effect.
