instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What options are available for the Dehumidification Control Type?
output: Select from ConstantSensibleHeatRatio Humidistat None or ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does ConstantSensibleHeatRatio mean in Dehumidification Control Type?
output: ConstantSensibleHeatRatio means that the ideal loads system will be controlled to meet the sensible cooling load and the latent cooling rate will be computed using a constant sensible heat ratio (SHR).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does Humidistat mean in Dehumidification Control Type?
output: Humidistat means that there is a ZoneControl:Humidistat for this zone and the ideal loads system will attempt to meet the humidistat request.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does None mean in Dehumidification Control Type?
output: None means that there is no dehumidification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio mean in Dehumidification Control Type?
output: ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio means that during cooling the supply air will always be at the Minimum Cooling Supply Humidity Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the mixed air humidity ratio is less than the target humidity ratio for ConstantSensibleHeatRatio and Humidistat?
output: If the mixed air humidity ratio is less than the target humidity ratio then the mixed air humidity ratio will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the rule for the supply air humidity ratio in all options of Dehumidification Control Type?
output: The supply air humidity ratio will never be allowed to exceed saturation at the supply dry bulb temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the selected dehumidification control type applied?
output: The selected dehumidification control type is always applied when the unit is in cooling mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Humidistat control type active?
output: If the unit is in deadband mode control type Humidistat will be active. If the unit is in heating mode control type Humidistat will be active if the Humidification Control Type field below is set to Humidistat or None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Cooling Sensible Heat Ratio field specify?
output: When the Dehumidification Control Type is set to ConstantSensibleHeatRatio the ideal loads system will be controlled to meet the sensible cooling load and the latent cooling rate will be computed using the value of Cooling Sensible Heat Ratio (SHR).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for Cooling Sensible Heat Ratio?
output: The default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Cooling Sensible Heat Ratio field ignored?
output: If Dehumidification Control Type is set to something other than ConstantSensibleHeatRatio then this field will be ignored.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Dehumidification Setpoint field specify?
output: This field specifies the zone humidistat relative humidity setpoint for dehumidification in percent.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the dehumidification control type 'Humidistat' mean in the context of an ideal loads system?
output: 'Humidistat' means that there is a ZoneControl:Humidistat for this zone and the ideal loads system will attempt to meet the humidistat request (i.e. will dehumidify according to the Dehumidifying Relative Humidity Schedule in the ZoneControl:Humidistat object).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the dehumidification control type 'None' mean?
output: 'None' means that there is no dehumidification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is meant by 'ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio' in dehumidification control?
output: 'ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio' means that during cooling the supply air will always be at the Minimum Cooling Supply Humidity Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the mixed air humidity ratio is less than the target humidity ratio for 'ConstantSensibleHeatRatio' and 'Humidistat'?
output: If the mixed air humidity ratio is less than the target humidity ratio then the mixed air humidity ratio will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the condition for the supply air humidity ratio in all dehumidification control options?
output: The supply air humidity ratio will never be allowed to exceed saturation at the supply dry bulb temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the selected dehumidification control type applied?
output: The selected dehumidification control type is always applied when the unit is in cooling mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What control type is active if the unit is in deadband mode?
output: If the unit is in deadband mode (not actively heating the supply air) control type 'Humidistat' will be active.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the unit is in heating mode regarding the dehumidification control type?
output: If the unit is in heating mode control type 'Humidistat' will be active if the Humidification Control Type field below is set to 'Humidistat' or 'None'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does this allow for the ideal loads system?
output: This allows the ideal loads system to heat and dehumidify at the same time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the Dehumidification Control Type is set to 'ConstantSensibleHeatRatio'?
output: When the Dehumidification Control Type is set to 'ConstantSensibleHeatRatio' the ideal loads system will be controlled to meet the sensible cooling load and the latent cooling rate will be computed using the value of Cooling Sensible Heat Ratio (SHR) where SHR = Sensible Cooling divided by Total Cooling (sensible plus latent).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default Cooling Sensible Heat Ratio (SHR)?
output: The default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if Dehumidification Control Type is set to something other than 'ConstantSensibleHeatRatio'?
output: If Dehumidification Control Type is set to something other than 'ConstantSensibleHeatRatio' then this field will be ignored.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Dehumidification Setpoint field specify?
output: This field specifies the zone humidistat relative humidity setpoint for dehumidification in percent (0 to 100).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default dehumidification setpoint?
output: The default is 60%.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Dehumidification Setpoint field used?
output: This field is used only when the Dehumidification Control Type = 'Humidistat.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What options are available for the Humidification Control Type?
output: Select from 'None' 'Humidistat' or 'ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the humidification control type 'None' mean?
output: 'None' means that there is no humidification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the humidification control type 'Humidistat' mean?
output: 'Humidistat' means that there is a ZoneControl:Humidistat for this zone and the ideal loads system will attempt to meet the humidistat request (i.e. humidify according to the Humidifying Relative Humidity Setpoint Schedule in the ZoneControl:Humidistat object).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is meant by 'ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio' in humidification control?
output: 'ConstantSupplyHumidityRatio' means that during heating the supply air will always be at the Maximum Heating Supply Humidity Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default humidification control type?
output: The default is 'None'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the mixed air humidity ratio is greater than the target humidity ratio for 'Humidistat'?
output: If the mixed air humidity ratio is greater than the target humidity ratio then the mixed air humidity ratio will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the condition for the supply air humidity ratio in all humidification control options?
output: The supply air humidity ratio will never be allowed to exceed saturation at the supply dry bulb temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the selected humidification control type applied?
output: The selected humidification control type is always applied when the unit is in heating mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What control type is active if the unit is in deadband mode?
output: If the unit is in deadband mode (not actively heating the supply air) control type 'Humidistat' will be active.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the unit is in cooling mode regarding the humidification control type?
output: If the unit is in cooling mode control type 'Humidistat' will be active if the Dehumidification Control Type field above is set to 'Humidistat' or 'None'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does this allow for the ideal loads system?
output: This allows the ideal loads system to cool and humidify at the same time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Humidification Setpoint field specify?
output: This field specifies the zone humidistat relative humidity setpoint for humidification in percent (0 to 100).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default humidification setpoint?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
